title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0241

segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Katherine.
segments.cn: 我叫Katherine。

segments.en: And today we've got part three of an exciting series we've got for you at the elementary level.
segments.cn: 今天我们将为您带来初级系列的第三部分。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: As you may remember, this is a series that we're studying all about a job interview.
segments.cn: 正如您所记得的，这是一个关于求职面试的系列。

segments.en: So in the first part, we just talked about the introduction.
segments.cn: 在第一部分中，我们讨论了介绍。

segments.en: The second part was talking about your personal background.
segments.cn: 第二部分谈到了个人背景。

segments.en: And now we're going to talk about your educational background.
segments.cn: 现在我们要谈谈教育背景。

segments.en: Okay, so the key topic here today is education.
segments.cn: 好的，今天的关键主题是教育。

segments.en: Let's take a listen to this dialogue and we'll be back in a minute.
segments.cn: 让我们听一下这个对话，稍后再回来。

segments.en: Now if I look here, I see that you completed a BA in English.
segments.cn: 现在如果我看这里，我看到您完成了英语学士学位。

segments.en: Yes, that's right.
segments.cn: 是的，没错。

segments.en: After graduating from high school in New York, I attended York University in the UK.
segments.cn: 在纽约高中毕业后，我在英国的约克大学就读。

segments.en: My major was English and my minor was business.
segments.cn: 我的专业是英语，辅修是商业。

segments.en: I completed my BA in 2004.
segments.cn: 我在2004年完成了学士学位。

segments.en: Yes, I'm pleased to see that you also got a distinction.
segments.cn: 是的，我很高兴看到您也获得了优异成绩。

segments.en: Yes, that's right.
segments.cn: 是的，没错。

segments.en: I've always enjoyed studying.
segments.cn: 我一直喜欢学习。

segments.en: My friends say I'm a bit of a bookworm, but my father always pushed us to succeed at school.
segments.cn: 我的朋友说我有点书呆子，但我父亲总是鼓励我们在学校取得成功。

segments.en: Well, it looks like his encouragement paid off, Rebecca.
segments.cn: 看来他的鼓励是有回报的，Rebecca。

segments.en: So how about extracurricular activities at university?
segments.cn: 那么在大学的课外活动呢？

segments.en: Well, I've always been keen on writing, so I became the editor for the university student newspaper, which I really loved.
segments.cn: 我一直对写作很感兴趣，所以我成为了大学学生报的编辑，我非常喜欢这个工作。

segments.en: Also, I volunteered for a Providing warm meals and shelter, especially in the winter months.
segments.cn: 此外，我还志愿为提供温暖的餐食和庇护，尤其是在冬季。

segments.en: I found it really fulfilling to be part of that group.
segments.cn: 我觉得能成为这个团队的一员非常有成就感。

segments.en: I'm sure.
segments.cn: 我相信。

segments.en: Okay, now let's move on to your work experience, shall we?
segments.cn: 好的，现在让我们继续谈谈您的工作经验，好吗？

segments.en: Yeah, okay.
segments.cn: 嗯，好吧。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So the girl was talking about her education, about her university, and she talked about some very interesting words.
segments.cn: 所以女孩在谈论她的教育，她的大学，并且她提到了一些非常有趣的词汇。

segments.en: So why don't we take a look at those and language takeaway?
segments.cn: 那么我们为什么不看看这些语言要点呢？

segments.en: Language takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言要点。

segments.en: So at the very beginning, Mr. Parsons, who's the interviewer here, asks Rebecca about her background and says, I see that you completed your BA in English.
segments.cn: 在一开始，面试官Parsons先生问Rebecca关于她的背景，并说，我看到您完成了英语学士学位。

segments.en: Okay, so we have an acronym there, a BA.
segments.cn: 好的，我们有一个缩写，BA。

segments.en: This stands for bachelors or usually a four-year degree at the beginning of your university studies.
segments.cn: 这代表学士学位，通常是您大学学习的四年学位。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So it's a type of degree, right?
segments.cn: 所以这是一种学位，对吗？

segments.en: A BA is, as you say, your bachelor's degree, and it usually takes four years.
segments.cn: BA就是您所说的学士学位，通常需要四年。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: You have a Bachelor of the Arts, BA, but you also have a Bachelor of Science, which is a BS.
segments.cn: 您有文学学士学位BA，但您也有理学学士学位BS。

segments.en: So as you can tell, one is for the arts, like art history, music, things like that.
segments.cn: 所以您可以看出，一个是艺术类的，比如艺术史、音乐等。

segments.en: The other is for sciences, like physics or chemistry.
segments.cn: 另一个是科学类的，比如物理或化学。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: All right, so she has a BA in English.
segments.cn: 好的，所以她有英语学士学位。

segments.en: So she obviously studied the English language in university.
segments.cn: 所以她显然在大学学习了英语。

segments.en: Then she moved on to talk about her major and minor.
segments.cn: 然后她继续谈论她的专业和辅修。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So as you know, a degree is not just a degree in the arts in general, but it usually has a focus or an area of focus.
segments.cn: 正如您所知，学位不仅仅是一般的艺术学位，通常还有一个重点或专注领域。

segments.en: So her area of focus, her major was English.
segments.cn: 所以她的专注领域，她的专业是英语。

segments.en: This is the most important part of her studies.
segments.cn: 这是她学习中最重要的部分。

segments.en: So many of her courses, most of her courses at university were in English.
segments.cn: 她在大学的大部分课程都是英语。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: But she also has a minor in business studies.
segments.cn: 但她也有商业研究的辅修。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: That means she also studied business and business studies.
segments.cn: 这意味着她也学习了商业和商业研究。

segments.en: That's not as important as her English studies, but it was very much a part of her degree.
segments.cn: 这虽然不如她的英语研究重要，但也是她学位的一部分。

segments.en: So let's say that when she was studying in university, 70% of what she studied was related to her major English and maybe 30% was her minor was business studies.
segments.cn: 所以可以说，当她在大学学习时，70%的学习与她的专业英语相关，30%是她的辅修商业研究。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And she goes on to talk about herself and her friends who describe her as a bookworm.
segments.cn: 她接着谈到自己和朋友们形容她为书呆子。

segments.en: This is a really nice adjective and very common in English.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常好的形容词，在英语中非常常见。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So if you are a bookworm or you describe yourself as a bookworm, it means that you like to study a lot.
segments.cn: 所以如果您是书呆子，或者您形容自己是书呆子，这意味着您喜欢学习很多。

segments.en: You like to read a lot of books.
segments.cn: 您喜欢读很多书。

segments.en: So bookworm is just like what you said, is someone who really likes to read, someone who's always reading, maybe someone who lives in the library.
segments.cn: 所以书呆子就像您所说的，是一个非常喜欢阅读的人，可能是一个总是在阅读的人，或者是一个住在图书馆的人。

segments.en: So that's why you call them a bookworm.
segments.cn: 所以这就是为什么称他们为书呆子。

segments.en: They live in the library or they read a lot of books.
segments.cn: 他们住在图书馆，或者他们读很多书。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So that's the noun bookworm.
segments.cn: 所以这就是名词书呆子。

segments.en: Now moving on to other parts of university.
segments.cn: 现在继续谈论大学的其他部分。

segments.en: When you're studying, you're not only studying English or sciences and things like that.
segments.cn: 当您学习时，您不仅仅是在学习英语或科学等。

segments.en: Sometimes you also do other activities or other things.
segments.cn: 有时您还会做其他活动或其他事情。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So you have your schoolwork, which is during school.
segments.cn: 所以您有学校作业，这在上学期间。

segments.en: It's English and business studies for this woman, Rebecca.
segments.cn: 对于这个女人Rebecca来说，是英语和商业研究。

segments.en: But you also have what you do outside of school.
segments.cn: 但您也有在校外的活动。

segments.en: This is called extracurricular activities.
segments.cn: 这被称为课外活动。

segments.en: So it's a long word, extracurricular.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个长词，课外活动。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So extracurricular means it's not in the curriculum, right?
segments.cn: 所以课外活动意味着它不在课程中，对吗？

segments.en: It's outside of school.
segments.cn: 它是在学校之外。

segments.en: So it's not really like a specific subject or something that's related to your studies.
segments.cn: 所以这并不是真正的特定科目或与您的学习相关的东西。

segments.en: If you don't do extracurricular activities, it's okay, right?
segments.cn: 如果您不参加课外活动，也没关系，对吗？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: A lot of people don't do any extracurricular activities, but many people do.
segments.cn: 很多人不参加任何课外活动，但很多人会参加。

segments.en: For example, writing for the school newspaper or playing soccer.
segments.cn: 例如，为学校报纸写作或踢足球。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So those are extracurricular activities.
segments.cn: 所以这些就是课外活动。

segments.en: Anything that you want to do in university, apart from studying, playing soccer, writing, etc.
segments.cn: 在大学里，您想做的任何事情，除了学习、踢足球、写作等。

segments.en: And it's not just university.
segments.cn: 而且不仅仅是大学。

segments.en: You can do these in high school as well.
segments.cn: 您在高中也可以做这些。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: So those are the words that we have picked out for you today.
segments.cn: 所以这些是我们今天为您挑选的词汇。

segments.en: I think they're very specific to education.
segments.cn: 我认为它们与教育非常相关。

segments.en: And I think we should go back, listen to the dialogue again.
segments.cn: 我们应该回去，再听一遍对话。

segments.en: And we'll be back in a bit with Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 然后我们将与流利度提升一起回来。

segments.en: Now, if I look here, I see that you completed a BA in English.
segments.cn: 现在，如果我看这里，我看到您完成了英语学士学位。

segments.en: Yes, that's right.
segments.cn: 是的，没错。

segments.en: After graduating from high school in New York, I attended York University in the UK.
segments.cn: 在纽约高中毕业后，我在英国的约克大学就读。

segments.en: My major was English, and my minor was business.
segments.cn: 我的专业是英语，辅修是商业。

segments.en: I completed my BA in 2004.
segments.cn: 我在2004年完成了学士学位。

segments.en: Yes, I'm pleased to see that you also got a distinction.
segments.cn: 是的，我很高兴看到你也获得了优异成绩。

segments.en: Yes, that's right.
segments.cn: 是的，没错。

segments.en: I've always enjoyed studying.
segments.cn: 我一直喜欢学习。

segments.en: My friends say I'm a bit of a bookworm, but my father always pushed us to succeed at school.
segments.cn: 我的朋友说我有点书呆子，但我父亲总是鼓励我们在学校取得成功。

segments.en: Well, it looks like his encouragement paid off, Rebecca.
segments.cn: 嗯，看起来他的鼓励得到了回报，丽贝卡。

segments.en: So how about extracurricular activities at university?
segments.cn: 那么大学的课外活动呢？

segments.en: Well, I've always been keen on writing.
segments.cn: 嗯，我一直热衷于写作。

segments.en: So I became the editor for the university student newspaper, which I really loved.
segments.cn: 所以我成为了大学学生报的编辑，我非常喜欢这个工作。

segments.en: Also, I volunteered for a group called Shelter to help the homeless in York.
segments.cn: 此外，我还为一个叫做“庇护所”的组织做志愿者，帮助约克的无家可归者。

segments.en: What did that involve?
segments.cn: 那涉及什么？

segments.en: Providing warm meals and shelter, especially in the winter months.
segments.cn: 提供温暖的餐食和庇护，尤其是在冬季。

segments.en: I found it really fulfilling to be part of that group.
segments.cn: 我觉得参与这个组织真的很有成就感。

segments.en: I'm sure.
segments.cn: 我相信。

segments.en: Okay, now let's move on to your work experience, shall we?
segments.cn: 好的，现在让我们继续谈谈你的工作经验，好吗？

segments.en: Yeah, okay.
segments.cn: 是的，好的。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now let's start off with our first phrase on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在让我们开始流利构建的第一个短语。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 流利构建。

segments.en: So Rebecca's talking about her father and her friends, and she says she's a bookworm, but her father always pushed us, that means her and her family members, her siblings, to succeed.
segments.cn: 所以丽贝卡谈到了她的父亲和朋友，她说她是个书呆子，但她的父亲总是推动我们，也就是她和她的家人、兄弟姐妹，去取得成功。

segments.en: And this verb, to push us, to push someone, is very important because it's not the same as to push a door.
segments.cn: 而这个动词，推动我们，推动某人，非常重要，因为这与推门不同。

segments.en: Right, so it's not physically that you're pushing somebody.
segments.cn: 对，所以并不是在物理上推某人。

segments.en: It's actually to motivate somebody or to inspire someone to become better at something.
segments.cn: 实际上是激励某人或启发某人变得更好。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So to push someone is to encourage them to do something bad.
segments.cn: 所以推动某人是鼓励他们做一些不好的事情。

segments.en: It's not always a good thing.
segments.cn: 这并不总是好事。

segments.en: So she was always pushing me to do what she wanted to do, not what I wanted to do.
segments.cn: 所以她总是推动我去做她想做的事情，而不是我想做的事情。

segments.en: That means someone's always trying to influence you or to get you to do something.
segments.cn: 这意味着某人总是在试图影响你或让你做某事。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So as you say, to push someone is to influence them, to motivate them, to encourage them to do something good or bad.
segments.cn: 所以正如你所说，推动某人是影响他们，激励他们，鼓励他们做一些好或坏的事情。

segments.en: Well, and Mr. Parsons agreed with her dad's encouragement, and he said, well, it really paid off.
segments.cn: 嗯，帕森斯先生同意她父亲的鼓励，他说，嗯，这确实得到了回报。

segments.en: Okay, this is a great verbal phrase, to pay off.
segments.cn: 好的，这是一个很好的动词短语，得到回报。

segments.en: This means to have benefits.
segments.cn: 这意味着有好处。

segments.en: Okay, so all of your hard work really paid off.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你所有的努力确实得到了回报。

segments.en: So you can see the results.
segments.cn: 所以你可以看到结果。

segments.en: You can see the positive results of your hard work.
segments.cn: 你可以看到你努力工作的积极结果。

segments.en: It paid off.
segments.cn: 它得到了回报。

segments.en: You could even ask someone, all that hard work, did it pay off?
segments.cn: 你甚至可以问某人，所有的努力，值得吗？

segments.en: Right, so that you're basically asking, was it worth it?
segments.cn: 对，所以你基本上在问，值得吗？

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Okay, to pay off.
segments.cn: 好的，得到回报。

segments.en: And well, when she was talking about extracurricular activities, she said she was always keen on writing.
segments.cn: 而且，当她谈到课外活动时，她说她一直热衷于写作。

segments.en: Now, I think this is more common among British people to say you're keen on something, but it basically means to like.
segments.cn: 现在，我认为这在英国人中更常见，说你对某事感兴趣，但这基本上意味着喜欢。

segments.en: So remember the phrase keen on.
segments.cn: 所以记住短语热衷于。

segments.en: This is the preposition here, keen on.
segments.cn: 这是这里的介词，热衷于。

segments.en: I'm keen on writing.
segments.cn: 我热衷于写作。

segments.en: So can you say that you are keen on someone?
segments.cn: 那么你能说你对某人感兴趣吗？

segments.en: Yes, you can.
segments.cn: 是的，可以。

segments.en: That means you like someone, maybe romantically.
segments.cn: 这意味着你喜欢某人，也许是浪漫的。

segments.en: Okay, so it's kind of a, as Catherine said, more of a British thing, but it's correct and you can use it in replacement of to like.
segments.cn: 好的，所以这有点像，正如凯瑟琳所说，更像是英国的说法，但这是正确的，你可以用它来替代喜欢。

segments.en: I think it also sounds a little bit more formal.
segments.cn: 我认为这听起来也更正式一些。

segments.en: Instead of saying, well, I've always liked writing.
segments.cn: 而不是说，嗯，我一直喜欢写作。

segments.en: If she says, well, I've always been keen on writing.
segments.cn: 如果她说，嗯，我一直热衷于写作。

segments.en: I think it sounds nice.
segments.cn: 我觉得这听起来不错。

segments.en: A little smarter.
segments.cn: 更聪明一点。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: And our last word.
segments.cn: 我们最后一个词。

segments.en: It's actually an interesting word.
segments.cn: 这实际上是一个有趣的词。

segments.en: It might be a little bit complicated to understand, but when she said that volunteering was very fulfilling and to be part of a group.
segments.cn: 这可能有点复杂，但当她说志愿服务是非常有成就感的，成为一个团体的一部分。

segments.en: Okay, fulfilling sounds a lot like the word filling, but you shouldn't confuse these two because the meaning is very different, right?
segments.cn: 好的，有成就感听起来很像填充这个词，但你不应该混淆这两个，因为意义非常不同，对吧？

segments.en: So something that is fulfilling makes you feel really good.
segments.cn: 所以某些事情是有成就感的，会让你感觉很好。

segments.en: You maybe, maybe you don't make money from it or you don't get a lot of praise from it, but it still makes you feel happy about life for yourself or something.
segments.cn: 你可能，可能你没有从中赚钱，或者你没有得到很多赞扬，但它仍然让你对生活感到快乐。

segments.en: So you get satisfaction.
segments.cn: 所以你获得了满足感。

segments.en: Now notice the pronunciation.
segments.cn: 现在注意发音。

segments.en: You don't say fulfilling.
segments.cn: 你不说有成就感。

segments.en: No, you say fulfilling.
segments.cn: 不，你说有成就感。

segments.en: Fulfilling.
segments.cn: 有成就感。

segments.en: So the L there is kind of silent.
segments.cn: 所以那里的L有点是无声的。

segments.en: Kind of optional, but maybe you could ask someone, what do you find fulfilling in your life?
segments.cn: 有点可选，但也许你可以问某人，你在生活中发现什么是有成就感的？

segments.en: Or you can ask, do you think your job is fulfilling?
segments.cn: 或者你可以问，你认为你的工作是有成就感的吗？

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So a lot of great words there.
segments.cn: 所以有很多很棒的词。

segments.en: A lot of interesting things related to education and not so much.
segments.cn: 许多与教育相关的有趣事物，不太多。

segments.en: Why don't we go back and listen to the dialogue one last time?
segments.cn: 我们为什么不回去再听一次对话呢？

segments.en: Now, if I look here, I see that you completed a BA in English.
segments.cn: 现在，如果我在这里看，我看到你获得了英语学士学位。

segments.en: Yes, that's right.
segments.cn: 是的，没错。

segments.en: After graduating from high school in New York, I attended York university in the UK.
segments.cn: 从纽约高中毕业后，我在英国的约克大学就读。

segments.en: My major was English and my minor was business.
segments.cn: 我的专业是英语，辅修是商业。

segments.en: I completed my BA in 2004.
segments.cn: 我在2004年完成了学士学位。

segments.en: Yes.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: I'm pleased to see that you also got a distinction.
segments.cn: 我很高兴看到你也获得了优异成绩。

segments.en: Yes, that's right.
segments.cn: 是的，没错。

segments.en: I've always enjoyed studying.
segments.cn: 我一直喜欢学习。

segments.en: My friends say I'm a bit of a bookworm, but my father always pushed us to succeed at school.
segments.cn: 我的朋友说我有点书呆子，但我父亲总是推动我们在学校取得成功。

segments.en: Well, it looks like his encouragement paid off Rebecca.
segments.cn: 嗯，看起来他的鼓励得到了回报，丽贝卡。

segments.en: So how about extracurricular activities at university?
segments.cn: 那么大学的课外活动呢？

segments.en: Well, I've always been keen on writing, so I became the editor for the university student newspaper, which I really loved.
segments.cn: 嗯，我一直热衷于写作，所以我成为了大学学生报的编辑，我非常喜欢这个工作。

segments.en: Also, I volunteered for a group called Shelter to help the homeless in New York.
segments.cn: 此外，我还为一个叫做“庇护所”的组织做志愿者，帮助纽约的无家可归者。

segments.en: What did that involve?
segments.cn: 那涉及什么？

segments.en: Providing warm meals and shelter, especially in the winter months.
segments.cn: 提供温暖的餐食和庇护，尤其是在冬季。

segments.en: I found it really fulfilling to be part of that group.
segments.cn: 我觉得参与这个组织真的很有成就感。

segments.en: I'm sure.
segments.cn: 我相信。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Now let's move on to your work experience, shall we?
segments.cn: 现在我们来谈谈你的工作经验，好吗？

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So talking about going to university, I think they used a really specific verb there that's worth mentioning.
segments.cn: 所以谈到上大学，我觉得她用的一个非常具体的动词值得一提。

segments.en: She said, I attended York University in the UK.
segments.cn: 她说，我在英国的约克大学就读。

segments.en: So to attend.
segments.cn: 所以“就读”。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So you can say I studied at York University, but the more formal way of saying that I was a student at York University is to say I attended that school.
segments.cn: 所以你可以说我在约克大学学习，但更正式的说法是我就读于那所学校。

segments.en: So to attend means to be a student at that place.
segments.cn: 所以“就读”意味着在那个地方做学生。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And what about you, Catherine?
segments.cn: 凯瑟琳，你呢？

segments.en: Did you participate in any extracurricular activities back in college?
segments.cn: 你在大学时参加过任何课外活动吗？

segments.en: I did.
segments.cn: 参加过。

segments.en: I participated in a lot of extracurricular activities.
segments.cn: 我参加了很多课外活动。

segments.en: I was in the orchestra at my university and I played in a lot of musical groups.
segments.cn: 我在大学的乐团里，还参加了很多音乐团体。

segments.en: I also was in a discussion group for politics and the India Pakistan dialogue group.
segments.cn: 我还参加了一个政治讨论小组和印度-巴基斯坦对话小组。

segments.en: And I was in a number of different film clubs.
segments.cn: 我还参加了几个不同的电影俱乐部。

segments.en: So we talk about film and I even helped out at the TV station for my university.
segments.cn: 我们讨论电影，我甚至在大学的电视台帮忙。

segments.en: Oh, wow.
segments.cn: 哦，哇。

segments.en: The university had a TV station.
segments.cn: 大学有电视台。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: So all of it was student directed.
segments.cn: 所以这一切都是由学生主导的。

segments.en: So basically the students controlled the TV station.
segments.cn: 基本上，学生控制了电视台。

segments.en: That's really interesting.
segments.cn: 这真的很有趣。

segments.en: I think these types of extracurricular activities are as many as these are maybe not as common in other places, or maybe they're a little bit different.
segments.cn: 我觉得这些类型的课外活动在其他地方可能不太常见，或者可能有些不同。

segments.en: I know, for example, in the US you have all these political ones and a lot of sports and things like that, but you also have very strange far ones like, I don't know, like there's a cooking club and there's even like a gardening club, I've heard.
segments.cn: 我知道，例如在美国，你有很多政治类的活动，还有很多体育活动，但你也有一些很奇怪的活动，比如，我不知道，有烹饪俱乐部，甚至还有园艺俱乐部，我听说过。

segments.en: Astronomy club.
segments.cn: 天文学俱乐部。

segments.en: Astronomy club.
segments.cn: 天文学俱乐部。

segments.en: There's all types of extracurricular activities.
segments.cn: 各种各样的课外活动。

segments.en: Well, what's really nice about a lot of American universities is that there are many, many resources that students can use.
segments.cn: 好吧，很多美国大学的一个好处是有很多资源供学生使用。

segments.en: And so maybe the reason there's a cooking club is because there are massive kitchens the students can use to cook food and experiment and even teachers and professors sometimes come to help.
segments.cn: 所以也许烹饪俱乐部的存在是因为有大型厨房，学生可以用来做饭和实验，甚至老师和教授有时也会来帮忙。

segments.en: So it's a really nice environment because everyone's teaching each other.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个非常好的环境，因为每个人都在教彼此。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: No, it's very, very interesting.
segments.cn: 不，这真的很有趣。

segments.en: And we're actually curious to know how universities work in your country.
segments.cn: 我们实际上很好奇你们国家的大学是如何运作的。

segments.en: Are you able to have a minor in a subject?
segments.cn: 你能在某个学科上辅修吗？

segments.en: Because many universities don't offer this option.
segments.cn: 因为许多大学不提供这个选项。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: They just have one major and that's all.
segments.cn: 他们只有一个主修，其他的就没有了。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Or maybe are you able to participate in extracurricular activities?
segments.cn: 或者你能参加课外活动吗？

segments.en: Like sports or radio or writing?
segments.cn: 比如体育、广播或写作？

segments.en: Let us know.
segments.cn: 让我们知道。

segments.en: Our website is EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 我们的网站是EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So we'll see you guys there.
segments.cn: 所以我们在那见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。
